## Definition

Coarctation of the aorta (CoA) is a narrowing of the aorta, the results of which could range from
asymptomatic, hypertension in children and early adults, to acute neonatal emergency.

![Coarctation of the aorta](images/cvs-coa.jpg){#fig-cvs-coa fig-align="center"}

## Incidence/prevalence

Worldwide, CoA is thought to occur in about 6-10% of children with congenital heart diseases. A
review of the echocardiographic findings in Kumasi however resulted in a prevalence of 1.3%.
